instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2914 slow
threads.message:
Arrived with typical horizontal lines on screen.

replaced GPU and board  now boots into OS but runs very slow.

passed ASD test and fans are running at normal speed.

on HW monitor gpu die and airport proximity are 128C

What should be checked next?

threads.title: 820-2914 slow
threads.message:
Connect external monitor and check againg GPU die temp.
Also try another airport module/cable.

Check for knocked off componentes, related with U5550.

threads.title: 820-2914 slow
threads.message:
With external monitor only the lag goes away, GPU die temp goes to normal.

How can the internal screen cause the lag? Does it need to be replaced to solve the issue?

threads.title: 820-2914 slow
threads.message:
Do you mean the machine works good with external monitor connected?
In such case, you have a problem with iGPU.
External monitor connection automatically enables discrete GPU.

threads.title: 820-2914 slow
threads.message:
Yes works good with external monitor connected.

is "iGPU" considered the AMD GPU?

threads.title: 820-2914 slow
threads.message:
iGPU reffers to Intel Graphics, integrated into CPU.
Discard a RAM issue first.
Try one known good DDR module at a time, each slot separately.

threads.title: 820-2914 slow
threads.message: If there is no ram issue would this be considered a no fix then?

threads.title: 820-2914 slow
threads.message: If only fails Intel graphics, then bad CPU...
